skills.skill: Prograddddmming experience with Java, C#, C++ using OOP & other key concepts.
Strong emphasis on maintainable, readable and clean code.

This helped with feature development in my personal project. When I would create new pull requests the pull request would only be approvable once the pipeline is green. This helped me ensure the new code that I have just added is robust and doesn’t break any pre-existing code.

skillVariantTwo.skill: Programmdddding experience with Java, C#, C++ using OOP & other key concepts.
A strong emphasis on maintainable & clean readable code.

children: Successfully implemented a Change App Icon feature into Capital One application.

Earned the mission Impossible award – “Releasing features on Android despite many problems”.
This feature was set out for the interns because my seniors thought it would be simple. This feature wasn’t a native feature on Android. So as the Android developer I faced a lot of challenges, but I still managed to complete this feature before the targeted code cut.
Created a competitive coding (player vs player) and algorithm-style question practise leetcode application using React.js, Springboot & MySql

Created a pipeline using GitLab to automate CI/CD & generate test reports.
This helped with feature development in my personal project. When I would create new pull requests the pull request would only be approvable once the pipeline is green. This helped me ensure the new code that I have just added is robust and doesn’t break any pre-existing code.
Worked with Lighthouse Systems web application that helps produce millions of products in manufacturing factories.
Hosted a project on AWS & worked with the cloud service during my time at Capital One.
Services used – Lamba, EC2, S3 Bucket, API gateway, RDS.
Developed new features in Capital One & Lighthouse Systems using TDD.
